bibl.title: Report of the Yellow Fever Commission, by Carlos J. Finlay, May 8, 1901

div1.p: The commission examines cases of yellow fever at San La zaro, Cuba. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Report of the Yellow Fever Commission, by Carlos J. Finlay, May 8, 1901
div1.opener:
No.
71
CIVIL DIVISION
DEPARTMENT OF CUBA
Rec'd 5/10/ 1901.
X
Headquarters Department of Cuba,
Received MAY 10 1901
HAVANA, CUBA,
May 8th, 1901.
DR. CHARLES FINLAY,
Yellow Fever Commission:
Report of operations
of the Board for the day.
-----
OK
-----
✓
✓
2-4
71
File.
GEM
Headquarters Department of Cuba.
OFFICE OF CHIEF SANITARY OFFICER OF HAVANA
----------
LA MAESTRANZA
CALLE DE CUBA
ENTRE CUARTELES Y CHACON
-----
Havana, Cuba, May 8th, 1901.
To the
Assistant Adjutant General,
Department of Cuba,
Havana.
Sir:-
div1.p:
The Yellow Fever Commission met pursuant to the call of the
Chairman. Present Doctors, Gorgas, Finlay, Guiteras and Albertini.

The Board then proceeded to San La zaro No. 247 and examined:
Case 1, Candida Vasquez, Vda de Cao, and deferred the Diagnosis.
